Mewtwonite X.embed: {"title":"Mewtwonite X","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Mega Evolves Mewtwo when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Mewtwonite Y.embed: {"title":"Mewtwonite Y","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Mega Evolves Mewtwo when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Sun Stone.embed: {"title":"Sun Stone","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000}],"description":"Evolves Gloom, Sunkern, Cottonee, Petilil, Helioptile","footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Shiny Stone.embed: {"title":"Shiny Stone","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000}],"description":"Evolves Eevee, Togetic, Roselia, Minccino, Floette","footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Dusk Stone.embed: {"title":"Dusk Stone","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000}],"description":"Evolves Eevee, Murkrow, Misdreavus, Lampent, Doublade","footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Dawn Stone.embed: {"title":"Dawn Stone","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000}],"description":"Evolves Eevee, Male Kirlia, Female Snorunt","footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Basic Ball.embed: {"title":"Basic Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":250},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"Basic Pok\u00e9 Ball; often called just a \u201cPok\u00e9 Ball\u201d.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Great Ball.embed: {"title":"Great Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":400},{"name":"Mod","value":-10}],"description":"A better Pok\u00e9 Ball with no special effects.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Master Ball.embed: {"title":"Master Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":-100}],"description":"Incredibly Rare. Worth at least $300,000. Sold nowhere.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Level Ball.embed: {"title":"Level Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is under half the level your active Pok\u00e9mon is.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Lure Ball.embed: {"title":"Lure Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target was baited into the encounter with food.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Sablenite.embed: {"title":"Sablenite","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Mega Evolves Sableye when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Salamencite.embed: {"title":"Salamencite","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Mega Evolves Salamence when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Pidgeotite.embed: {"title":"Pidgeotite","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Mega Evolves Pidgeotto when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Pinsirite.embed: {"title":"Pinsirite","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Mega Evolves Pinsir when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Dive Ball.embed: {"title":"Dive Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target was found underwater or underground.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Luxury Ball.embed: {"title":"Luxury Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":-5}],"description":"A caught Pok\u00e9mon is easily pleased and starts with a raised happiness.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Heal Ball.embed: {"title":"Heal Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":-5}],"description":"A caught Pok\u00e9mon will heal to Max HP immediately upon capture.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.273"}}

Quick Ball.embed: {"title":"Quick Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":-20}],"description":"+5 to Modifier after 1 round of the encounter, +10 to Modifier after round 2, +20 to modifier after round 3.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.273"}}

Dusk Ball.embed: {"title":"Dusk Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if it is dark, or if there is very little light out, when used.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.273"}}

Cherish Ball.embed: {"title":"Cherish Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":-5}],"description":"A decorative Pok\u00e9 Ball often given out during special events.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.273"}}

Re-Breather.embed: {"title":"Re-Breather","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":4000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"This small partial face mask allows Trainers and Pok\u00e9mon to breathe underwater as if they had the Gilled Capability for up to an hour. The Re-Breather is refilled automatically in 5 minutes while in open air.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Sunglasses.embed: {"title":"Sunglasses","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"+1 to Charm, Guile, and Intimidate Checks, to a maximum total modifier of +3.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Heavy Ball.embed: {"title":"Heavy Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-5 Modifier for each Weight Class the target is above 1.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Fast Ball.embed: {"title":"Fast Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target has a Movement Capability above 7.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Storage Case.embed: {"title":"Storage Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":15000},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"These extremely useful cases are capable of \u201cCapturing\u201d non-living matter. Once applied to a Pok\u00e9 Ball, Storage Cases cannot be removed. The object or objects in question must be smaller than 2 meters in any dimension. A single Storage Case can capture several discrete objects, but they must all be supported by a single surface; a 2x2 meter rug or mat is often used for this purpose. Capture Rolls against inanimate objects automatically succeed. Pok\u00e9 Balls with Storage Cases count towards the total number of Pok\u00e9mon that the trainer can carry. Storage Cases are often illegal due to their uses in smuggling and theft.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Bounce Case.embed: {"title":"Bounce Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"A Pok\u00e9 Ball in a Bounce Case may bounce once when thrown or launched, up to a distance of 3 meters. This can be used to extend the effective range of a Pok\u00e9 Ball, hit around obstacles, or trigger effects such as the Capture Specialist\u2019s Curve Ball on an additional target.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Contest Case.embed: {"title":"Contest Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":400},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"Whenever a Pok\u00e9mon is released from a Contest Case into a Contest, they gain 1 Appeal Point during the introduction stage.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Flash Case.embed: {"title":"Flash Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"When a Pok\u00e9 Ball with a Flash Case is thrown, it uses the Move Flash originating from the spot where it landed.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Nest Ball.embed: {"title":"Nest Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is under level 10.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Repeat Ball.embed: {"title":"Repeat Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if you already own a Pok\u00e9mon of the target\u2019s species.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Timer Ball.embed: {"title":"Timer Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+5"}],"description":"-5 to the Modifier after every round since the beginning of the encounter, until the Modifier is -20.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Net Ball.embed: {"title":"Net Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Water or Bug type.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Premier Ball.embed: {"title":"Premier Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"Given as promotional balls during sales.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Lock Case.embed: {"title":"Lock Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":400},{"name":"Mod","value":-10}],"description":"A Lock Case grants a -10 Capture modifier to any Pok\u00e9 Ball. It also stops Pok\u00e9mon from exiting Pok\u00e9 Balls unless explicitly released by their owners.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}

Devil Case.embed: {"title":"Devil Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"These dangerous and often illegal cases remove the failsafe on Pok\u00e9 Balls that prevents them from catching Pok\u00e9mon that are at 0 Hit Points or less. It allows Pok\u00e9 Balls to catch Fainted Pok\u00e9mon as normal, but automatically inflicts 2 Injuries when hitting a Pok\u00e9mon - whether the Capture is successful or not.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Heavy Armor.embed: {"title":"Heavy Armor","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":12000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"Heavy Armor grants +10 Damage Reduction. Heavy Armor causes the wearer\u2019s Speed\u2019s Default Combat Stage to be -1.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Air Ball.embed: {"title":"Air Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Flying or Ice type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Mold Ball.embed: {"title":"Mold Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Poison or Fighting type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Rain Ball.embed: {"title":"Rain Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the weather is rainy when used.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Sand Ball.embed: {"title":"Sand Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the weather is a sandstorm when used.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Sun Ball.embed: {"title":"Sun Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the weather is sunny when used.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Gossamer Ball.embed: {"title":"Gossamer Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Normal or Fairy type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Hail Ball.embed: {"title":"Hail Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the weather is hailing when used.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Solid Ball.embed: {"title":"Solid Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Rock or Steel type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Learning Ball.embed: {"title":"Learning Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":-5}],"description":"The captured Pok\u00e9mon immediately learns their next level-up Move, as long as it is within 8 levels of their current level.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Power Ball.embed: {"title":"Power Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is under level 10.  Target gains 1d4 levels upon capture.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Mystic Ball.embed: {"title":"Mystic Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Dragon or Psychic type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Earth Ball.embed: {"title":"Earth Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Grass or Ground type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Fancy Clothes.embed: {"title":"Fancy Clothes","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":5000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"Each set of Fancy Clothes is assigned a Contest Stat \u2013 either Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough. Trainers wearing these clothes may roll 2d6 during the Introduction Stage of a Contest to try to generate Contest Stat Dice for the assigned Stat.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Stealth Clothes.embed: {"title":"Stealth Clothes","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"Whether it\u2019s a dark cloak and hood, a ninja suit, or spy gear, these clothes help you blend in. This body-slot equipment raises your modifier to Stealth Checks made to remain unseen by +4, to a maximum total modifier of +4.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Dark Vision Goggles.embed: {"title":"Dark Vision Goggles","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"These Goggles simply grant the Darkvision Capability while worn.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Helmet.embed: {"title":"Helmet","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2250},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"The user gains 15 Damage Reduction against Critical Hits. The user resists the Moves Headbutt and Zen Headbutt and can\u2019t be flinched by these Moves.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Camera Kit.embed: {"title":"Camera Kit","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1200},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"A small camera, microphone, and speaker set affixed to the outside of a Pok\u00e9 Ball or Case. These allow a Trainer to remotely release and command their Pok\u00e9mon or attempt to capture a Pok\u00e9mon.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Bait Attachment.embed: {"title":"Bait Attachment","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":300},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"These attachments afix a piece of bait to the triggering device of a Pok\u00e9 Ball. When the bait is taken, the attachment automatically triggers a capture attempt along with any effect that would be caused by a Pok\u00e9 Ball Cases.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Tracking Chip.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Tracking Chip","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":200},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"A chip embedded in the inner workings of the Pok\u00e9 Ball that emits a signal allowing the Ball\u2019s owner to remotely track the location of the Ball. Depending on the setting, these may be built in by default.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.46"}}

Haunt Ball.embed: {"title":"Haunt Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Dark or Ghost type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Alarm.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Alarm","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1000},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"A belt with six slots for Pok\u00e9 Balls. Pok\u00e9 Balls affixed to the belt are locked in place with a number pad password to unlock them. Tampering with the belt triggers the password prompt, and failure to input the correct password within a minute triggers a loud alarm system.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.46"}}

Heat Ball.embed: {"title":"Heat Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-20 Modifier if the target is Electric or Fire type.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Weighted Nets.embed: {"title":"Weighted Nets","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"Varies"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"description":"Weighted Nets are foldable nets used for trapping Pok\u00e9mon. These two-handed nets, when Equipped, can be thrown at a target as a Standard Action, as a Status Attack with an AC of 8. While a Pok\u00e9mon is netted, you may pull on the rope attached to the Net to pull the Pok\u00e9mon 1 Meter towards you as a Standard Action. Pok\u00e9mon hit by a weighted net become Slowed as long as the net remains and cannot use Sky or Levitate Speeds except to safely lower themselves back to the ground. A Pok\u00e9mon may attack the Net to attempt to break free. Capture Rolls against Pok\u00e9mon in a net receive a -20 bonus.\n\nWeighted Nets with 50 Hit Points cost $500; 80 Hit Points cost $850; and 150 Hit Points cost $1200.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Capture Styler.embed: {"title":"Capture Styler","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":7500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"description":"A Capture Styler is a Main-Hand specialized piece of equipment used by some certified Pok\u00e9mon Rangers in a region. It emits a string of energy that is used in a similar fashion to a lasso but is too weak to physically restrain a target. Instead, the energy has a calming effect on Pok\u00e9mon. Trainers using a Capture Styler may use Survival in place of Charm when raising the Disposition of Pok\u00e9mon. \n\nAcquiring a Capture Styler is easy for those who become certified Pok\u00e9mon Rangers; most qualified Rangers receive one as part of the job. They are not for sale to the general public, and it\u2019s easy to assume that someone who has a Capture Styler is a Ranger.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Light Shield.embed: {"title":"Light Shield","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Off-Hand"}],"description":"A Shield is an Off-Hand defensive item held in one hand or braced to an arm. Light Shields grant +2 Evasion. They may be readied as a Standard Action to instead grant +4 Evasion and 10 Damage Reduction until the end of your next turn, but also cause you to become Slowed for that duration. If used Two-Handed, light shields can also function as a Small Melee Weapon.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Heavy Shield.embed: {"title":"Heavy Shield","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":4500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Off-Hand"}],"description":"A Shield is an Off-Hand defensive item held in one hand or braced to an arm. Heavy Shields grant +2 Evasion and may be readied as a Standard Action to grant +6 Evasion and 15 Damage Reduction until the end of your next turn, but also cause you to become Slowed for that duration. If used Two-Handed, shields can also function as a Small Melee Weapon.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Wonder Launcher.embed: {"title":"Wonder Launcher","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":10000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"description":"This strange and complicated two-handed machine can only be used by those that have an Expert-Level Medicine or Technology Education Skill. The wielder can spend 1 AP to activate it, and apply an X-Item at a Pok\u00e9mon within 8 meters. X Items applied through the Wonder Launcher do not cause the target to forfeit any actions. Items combined by a Researcher may be used in the Wonder Launcher, and do not cause the target to forfeit any actions even if they are also a Restorative.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Moon Stone.embed: {"title":"Moon Stone","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000}],"description":"Evolves Nidorina, Nidorino, Clefairy, Jigglypuff, Eevee, Skitty, Munna","footer":{"text":"Core: p.298"}}

Running Shoes.embed: {"title":"Running Shoes","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Feet"}],"description":"Running Shoes grant a +2 bonus to Athletics Checks, to a maximum total modifier of +3, and increase your Overland Speed by +1.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Flippers.embed: {"title":"Flippers","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Feet"}],"description":"Flippers grant a +2 bonus to your Swim speed when fully submerged, and decrease your Overland speed by the same amount.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Jungle Boots.embed: {"title":"Jungle Boots","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Feet"}],"description":"Jungle Boots grant you the Naturewalk (Forest) capability","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Fishing Rod.embed: {"title":"Fishing Rod","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"Varies"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"description":"Fishing Rods are used to Fish. They are two-handed items. They come in three varieties; Old Rods, Good Rods, and Super Rods.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Glue Cannon Charge Packet.embed: {"title":"Glue Cannon Charge Packet","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":100},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"A charge packet for Glue Cannons.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Hazmat Suit.embed: {"title":"Hazmat Suit","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body + Head"}],"description":"Acts as a Gas Mask but also grants the Hazard Immunity capability and immunity to non-damaging Poison Type Moves.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Focus (Item).embed: {"title":"Focus","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":6000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"description":"A Focus grants +5 Bonus to a Stat, chosen when crafted. This Bonus is applied AFTER Combat Stages. Focuses are often Accessory-Slot Items, but may be crafted as Head-Slot, Hand or Off-Hand Slot Items as well; a Trainer may only benefit from one Focus at a time, regardless of the Equipment Slot. Focuses are not usually found in stores, but may sometimes be found for $6000 at your GM\u2019s discretion.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Pester Balls.embed: {"title":"Pester Balls","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":350},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Pester Balls are small balls full of chemicals that come in six varieties, each of which inflicts a different Status Affliction when they hit a target. The Status Afflictions they can cause are: Rage, Confusion, Burn, Poison, Paralysis, and Sleep.\n\nAfter being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Mega Ring.embed: {"title":"Mega Ring","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"description":"Mega Rings are extraordinarily rare accessories that allow a Trainer\u2019s Pok\u00e9mon to Mega Evolve when used in conjunction with a Mega Stone. They cannot be bought in stores anywhere and must usually be earned through a trial of sorts, governed by a Gym Leader or other influential Pok\u00e9mon Trainer. They can take the form of a bracelet, a necklace, or an actual ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Caltrops.embed: {"title":"Caltrops","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Lets the user use the move Spikes as a Standard Action.  The item is then consumed.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Magic Flute.embed: {"title":"Magic Flute","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":4000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Item"}],"description":"Magic Flutes are rare artifacts made only by skilled crafters with occult knowledge. They are not usually found in stores. When a Flute is crafted, it is tied to a particular Status Condition. Once per day, the Flute may be played as a Standard Action. All Pok\u00e9mon and Trainers within 20 meters of the Flute are cured of that Status. These rare artifacts cannot be found in most ordinary stores but may cost upwards of $4000 from an appropriate occult vendor.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Rage.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Rage","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":350},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Inflicts Rage on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Burn.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Burn","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":350},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Inflicts Burn on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Poison.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Poison","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":350},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Inflicts Poison on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Paralysis.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Paralysis","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":350},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Inflicts Paralysis on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Sleep.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Sleep","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":350},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Causes the target to fall asleep. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pok\u00e9 Ball Cannon.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9 Ball Cannon","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":4500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main + Off Hand"}],"description":"Increases Pok\u00e9 Ball and Pester Ball accuracy by +1 and range to 15 meters. Balls deal 2d6 unreducible damage upon hitting a target. Balls take a Shift Action to ready in the Pok\u00e9 Ball Cannon.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.41"}}

Zap Blaster.embed: {"title":"Zap Blaster","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"description":"Uses the Move Zap Cannon once.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

Smoke Ball.embed: {"title":"Smoke Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"When used, a Smoke Ball creates a 3 meter blast that fills the area with smoke, as if the move Smokescreen had been used. Smoke Balls can only be found in specialty shops.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.83"}}

Toxic Caltrops.embed: {"title":"Toxic Caltrops","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Lets the user use the move Toxic Spikes as a Standard Action.  The item is then consumed.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pester Ball: Confusion.embed: {"title":"Pester Ball: Confusion","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":350},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Inflicts Confusion on the target. After being hit by any Pester Ball, a target becomes immune to the effects of further Pester Balls for 1 hour. Throwing and hitting with Pester Balls is the same as with Pok\u00e9 Balls.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Dream Mist (Item).embed: {"title":"Dream Mist","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Dream Mist may be used as an AC 6 Melee Status Attack, performed as a Standard Action. If it hits, the target falls Asleep. Dream Mist is collected from Pok\u00e9mon with the eponymous Capability using a Collection Jar.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Pheromone Cartridge.embed: {"title":"Pheromone Cartridge","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":250},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"A cartridge for the Pheromone Emitter.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Pheromone Emitter.embed: {"title":"Pheromone Emitter","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"description":"Emits pheromones as a Swift Action that give a +4 bonus to a Charm or Intimidate check against wild Pok\u00e9mon. Requires a Pheromone Cartridge to use. Comes with 1 Cartridge. More can be bought for 250 apiece.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Treecko Gear.embed: {"title":"Treecko Gear","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main + Off Hand, Feet"}],"description":"Grants the Wallclimber capability.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Extendable Grabby Arm.embed: {"title":"Extendable Grabby Arm","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":750},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main Hand"}],"description":"A dexterous and flexible arm with a hand at the end. Can be used to grab and manipulate objects from 3 meters away.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Thermal Dampening Suit.embed: {"title":"Thermal Dampening Suit","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"The user is invisible to thermal imaging gear.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Lifting Frame.embed: {"title":"Lifting Frame","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Main + Off Hand"}],"description":"A mechanized frame worn over each arm with motorized muscles. Grants +2 to Power Capability. The frames are too unwieldy to use other equipment such as weapons while wearing them.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Flashbang.embed: {"title":"Flashbang","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":250},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Throwing a Flashbang uses the Move Flash originating from the point where you threw the Flashbang, up to your maximum Pok\u00e9 Ball throwing range. When used in this way, Flash flinches all legal targets on 19-20 on Accuracy Check.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

Sting Grenade.embed: {"title":"Sting Grenade","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":250},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Throwing a Sting Grenade is an AC 4 Ranged Blast 3 attack that can be made at a target within your Pok\u00e9 Ball throwing range. Upon connecting, the Sting Grenade releases dozens of hard rubber balls around it, causing pain to the targets but no damage. Those targets take a -3 penalty to all rolls and to their evasion until the start of your next turn.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

Scrubbing Spray.embed: {"title":"Scrubbing Spray","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Off-Hand"}],"description":"Sprays a chemical agent over an area that destroys most forensic evidence, such as trace biomatter. Perception checks to track someone or to search for forensic evidence take a -6 penalty. Requires a Scrub Cartridge to use. Comes with 1 Cartridge. More can be bought for 300 apiece.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Universal Translator.embed: {"title":"Universal Translator","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":10000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"You understand any spoken language recognized by the Universal Translator and can speak into it and have your words translated immediately. Usually programmed with all of the major human languages. Can be used to speak with Pok\u00e9mon.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Gravity Modulation Suit.embed: {"title":"Gravity Modulation Suit","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":4000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"You may treat the local gravity as if it were 1 lower or 1 higher. Changing the setting on the suit is an At-Will Extended Action requiring time for the suit to adjust to the new settings.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Pok\u00e9radar.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9radar","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":5000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Off-Hand"}],"description":"Contrary to its name, this handheld device actually detects both human and Pok\u00e9mon lifesigns in a 20 meter radius and can display their relative location to you on a screen. No information is given about specific species.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

EMP Grenade.embed: {"title":"EMP Grenade","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Throwing an EMP Grenade is an AC 5 Ranged Blast 3 attack that can be made at a target within your Pok\u00e9 Ball throwing range. All legal targets with Augmentations immediately suffer the effects of Augmentation Shock. EMP Grenades flinch targets with Augmentations on a roll of 18+ on Accuracy Check. EMP Grenades disable Pok\u00e9bots for 1d2 turns.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.50"}}

X-Ray Goggles.embed: {"title":"X-Ray Goggles","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":8000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"Grants the user the X-Ray Vision Capability.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Mind Aegis.embed: {"title":"Mind Aegis","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":4000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"Grants a +6 bonus to Focus checks to resist Telepathy. If the wearer has the Iron Mind Edge, Mind Aegis grants the Mindlock capability instead.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Thermal Goggles.embed: {"title":"Thermal Goggles","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Head"}],"description":"Allows you to see in the IR spectrum, enabling you to easily pick out a person or Pok\u00e9mon in camouflage or to identify sources of heat.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Anomaly Detector.embed: {"title":"Anomaly Detector","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2150},{"name":"Slot","value":"Item"}],"description":"When pointed at a person, Pok\u00e9mon, or object, this handheld device can determine whether or not it belongs to this timeline or parallel universe. It gives no indication to the nature of the home universe, however.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Glitch Detection Crystal.embed: {"title":"Glitch Detection Crystal","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"description":"A crystal necklace which begins to display pixelated effects and static when near Glitch phenomena. Pixellation and static effects intensify proportionally to proximity to the phenomena.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.43"}}

Reinforced Trenchcoat.embed: {"title":"Reinforced Trenchcoat","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":10000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"A stylish utility version of Light Armor. Grants 5 Damage Reduction and provides a +4 bonus to Stealth checks to conceal weapons and prevents their detection by metal detectors.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Mesh Shielding.embed: {"title":"Mesh Shielding","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":8000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"An advanced anti-conductive fabric woven into a stiff jacket designed to shield sensitive electronics from damage and electrical shock. You gain 5 Damage Reduction against Electric Type damage. Whenever you would suffer Augmentation Shock, roll 1d2. On a 1, you suffer no ill effects.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Flame Retardant Armor.embed: {"title":"Flame Retardant Armor","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":5000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"You gain 10 Damage Reduction against Fire Type damage.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Dowsing Rod.embed: {"title":"Dowsing Rod","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000}],"description":"Dowsing Rods have been attuned to the energy resonance given off by Shards and may be used while in any route, cave, or outside area. They may be activated by spending 10 minutes searching an area, and may be activated a number of times per day equal to half of the trainer\u2019s Occult Education Rank.\n\nRoll 1d6 per Occult Ed Rank. If the area being searched is a beach, cave, desert, or any other sandy\/rocky area, roll +1d6. If you have Skill Stunt (Dowsing), roll an additional 1d6. For each die that results in 4 or higher, you find 1 Shard of a random color: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, or Violet. You may reroll any die that result in 6, gaining that shard and potentially more.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Orange Shard.embed: {"title":"Orange Shard","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Associated with Normal, Fighting, & Dragon.  With Gem Lore, 4 can be combined into a Shiny Stone.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Friend Ball.embed: {"title":"Friend Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":-5}],"description":"A caught Pok\u00e9mon will start with +1 Loyalty.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Pok\u00e9dex.embed: {"title":"Pok\u00e9dex","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":12000}],"description":"A hand-held computer with an advanced camera and image recognition software given to trainers at the start of their journey.  A trainer can use a Standard Action to identify a Pok\u00e9mon within 10m using the Pok\u00e9dex's scanner.  Doing so reveals the average height\/weight of the species, height\/weight of the target, moves that the Species learns through Level Up, and some brief facts about the species' behavior.\n\nPok\u00e9dexes may also function as smartphones, and in most circumstances they should be made available for free to starting characters.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.271"}}

Slipstream Armor.embed: {"title":"Slipstream Armor","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":10000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"A flexible and smooth light armor that can momentarily become nearly frictionless. Grants 5 Damage Reduction. Once a battle, the wearer may use a Swift Action to escape from being Stuck.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Sensor Disruption Vest.embed: {"title":"Sensor Disruption Vest","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"The specially designed material of this vest wreaks havoc with the sensors used on most Pok\u00e9bot models and Eye Augmentations. Pok\u00e9bots and any Trainers or Pok\u00e9mon with an Eye Augmentation suffer a -2 penalty to their single target Accuracy Checks made against the wearer.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Eviolite.embed: {"title":"Eviolite","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":4000}],"description":"Only affects not-fully-evolved Pok\u00e9mon of a single family, decided when the Eviolite is made. Grants a +5 Bonus to two different Stats, after Combat Stages, decided when the Eviolite is made. Prevents Pok\u00e9mon from evolving when held. Cannot be used by Trainers.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.296"}}

Type Gem.embed: {"title":"Type Gem","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"These items come in a variety of each of the Elemental Types, and are consumed as a Free Action to give a +3 Damage Base bonus to one attack of their Type. Off-hand or Accessory Slot Item for Trainers.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Metal Powder.embed: {"title":"Metal Powder","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"When held by an untransformed Ditto, increases both Defense and Special Defense by +2 Combat Stages. Cannot be used by Trainers.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Rare Leek.embed: {"title":"Rare Leek","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"When held by a Farfetch\u2019d, this rare Leek increase the holder\u2019s critical range by 2. Rare Leeks are Wielded. Cannot be used by Trainers.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Medichamite.embed: {"title":"Medichamite","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"Mega Evolves Medicham when used in conjuction with a Mega Ring.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Berserker Bolus.embed: {"title":"Berserker Bolus","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500}],"description":"A combat drug used by street gangs. Immediately inflicts 1 injury on the user upon taking it, but for the duration of the Scene, the user is immune to Flinch effects, gains a +2 bonus to Save Rolls, and adds 5 to all Damage Rolls. However, they are Enraged and may not make Save Rolls to end the effect until all combat ceases for at least a few minutes.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.47"}}

Salty Surprise.embed: {"title":"Salty Surprise","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":100}],"description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff when being hit by an attack to gain 5 Temporary Hit Points. If the user likes Salty Flavors, they gain 10 Temporary Hit Points Instead. If the user dislikes Salty Food, they become Enraged.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Bitter Treat.embed: {"title":"Bitter Treat","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":100}],"description":"The user may trade in this Snack\u2019s Digestion Buff when being hit by a Special Attack to increase their Damage Reduction by +5 against that attack. If the user prefers Bitter Food, they gain +10 Damage Reduction instead. If the user dislikes Bitter Food, they become Enraged.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.132"}}

Rare Candy.embed: {"title":"Rare Candy","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":9800}],"description":"These very rare treats are created from Shuckles that have held a Berry for a long time. When ingested by a Pok\u00e9mon, the eater gains enough experience to reach its next Level. Pok\u00e9mon may benefit from up to five Rare Candies in their lifetime.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.299"}}

Baby Food.embed: {"title":"Baby Food","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"A nutritious food that causes young Pok\u00e9mon to grow quickly. When consumed, increases Experience Gain of Pok\u00e9mon at level 15 or lower by 20% for the rest of the day.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.279"}}

Tamato Berry.embed: {"title":"Tamato Berry","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500}],"description":"Lowers Speed stat by 1 with trainer permission. Tier 3.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.283"}}

Payapa Berry.embed: {"title":"Payapa Berry","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500}],"description":"Weakens foe\u2019s super effective Psychic-type move. Tier 3.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.283"}}

Cleanse Tag.embed:
{"title":"Cleanse Tag","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Consumable"}],"description":"Small strips of paper with a prayer/incantation written on them. When created, the creator makes an Occult Ed Roll; this is the Cleanse Tag’s Power Value. When glued, taped, or nailed to a surface, they stop Pokémon or Trainers within 30m of the tag from Phasing through that surface unless they make a Focus check with a result exceeding the Tag’s Power Value. On a success, the tag is destroyed; on failure, the tag holds, and the encroacher cannot try again for at least an hour.

Tags may be stuck onto a weapon or appendage to let a Normal or Fighting-Type Attack hit a Ghost-Type Pokémon for neutral Damage; Tag is destroyed once damage is dealt.

Novice Occult Ed: Can burn tag as a Standard Action to remove Cursed, Suppressed, or Disabled condition from a single target within 5m.
Expert Occult Ed: Can burn tag to cause all with Invisibility and Phasing capabilities to make a Focus check; if result does not exceed tag's power value, capabilities lost for 5 min","footer":{"text":"Core: p.302"}}

Poffin Mixer.embed: {"title":"Poffin Mixer","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":500}],"description":"A Poffin Mixer can be used by any Trainer to create Poffins. You simply insert cooking ingredients worth $500, and at least one of the listed berries. You create two Poffins that raises the Contest Stat most represented by the berries used by +1 Contest Die. Some Berries can raise multiple Contest Stats; you choose which to raise when using these Berries to make Poffins. Poffins can be purchased for $500 in bakeries.\n\nCheri, Figy, Razz, Spelon and Belue Berries raise Cool; Chesto, Wiki, Bluk, Spelon and Pamtre Berries raise Beauty; Pecha, Mago, Nanab, Pamtre, and Watmel Berries raise Cute; Rawst, Aguav, Wepear, Watmel, and Durin Berries raise Smart; Aspear, Iapapa, Pinap, Durin, and Belue Berries raise Tough.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.284"}}

Snow Boots.embed: {"title":"Snow Boots","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Feet"}],"description":"Snow Boots grant you the Naturewalk (Tundra) capability, but lower your Overland Speed by -1 while on ice or deep snow.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.293"}}

Sonic Filter.embed: {"title":"Sonic Filter","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":2500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"description":"Creates a portable field of directed white noise with a 2 meter radius when activated. Anyone within can hold a conversation normally, but anyone outside the field just hears static coming from the direction of the wearer. Moves with the Sonic Keyword aimed at a target within the field require 2 more on Accuracy Roll to hit.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Ablative Heavy Armor.embed: {"title":"Ablative Heavy Armor","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":14500},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body"}],"description":"A weighty but brittle armor that is self-repairing. Grants 20 Damage Reduction, but each damaging attack removes 5 Damage Reduction from the armor. Every five minutes, the armor repairs 5 Damage Reduction. The user\u2019s Speed Combat Stage defaults to -1.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.51"}}

Spacesuit.embed: {"title":"Spacesuit","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":8000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Body + Head"}],"description":"Grants Vacuum Immunity and Free Floating 4. Weighs 200 pounds and is thus difficult for most Trainers to use in normal gravity. A Robotic Age upgraded version costing an extra $2000 confers Hazard Immunity too and weighs only 100 pounds instead.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.42"}}

Shock Collar.embed: {"title":"Shock Collar","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3500}],"description":"Comes with a remote activator, which when pressed, causes the Pok\u00e9mon or Trainer wearing the shock collar to lose Hit Points equal to 1\/6th of their Max Hit Points. This may be used to activate the \u201cPress\u201d Feature. Collars that work on Ground Type Pok\u00e9mon are available for an additional $500.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Zap Case.embed: {"title":"Zap Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":1500},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"Whenever a Pok\u00e9 Ball with a Zap Case hits a target it deals damage as if using a Struggle Attack. This Damage is Electric-Typed. If the Ball is already used as a Struggle Attack (such as with Curve Ball), then the Zap Case changes the damage to Electric-Type and adds bonus damage equal to twice the user\u2019s Technology Education skill. When attempting to catch Pok\u00e9mon, damage is resolved before the capture roll. This can also be used when releasing a Pok\u00e9mon (damage is resolved before the Pok\u00e9mon is released).","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.45"}}

Glue Cannon.embed: {"title":"Glue Cannon","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":3000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Hands"}],"description":"Glue Cannons are exactly what you expect; This two-handed Equipment piece is a hand-held cannon that launches globs of glue. Attacking with a Glue Cannon expends a charge, which must be purchased. The attack is an AC8 Status Attack. If it hits, the target is Slowed. On a critical hit, the target is instead Stuck and Trapped. The Glue Cannon and three charge packets cost $3000, and additional charge packets costs $100.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.294"}}

Thick Club.embed: {"title":"Thick Club","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"--"}],"description":"When held by a Cubone or Marowak, this rare, dense bone grants the Pure Power Ability. Thick Clubs are Wielded. Cannot be used by Trainers.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.297"}}

Love Ball.embed: {"title":"Love Ball","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":800},{"name":"Mod","value":"+0"}],"description":"-30 Modifier if the user has an active Pok\u00e9mon that is of the same evolutionary line as the target, and the opposite gender. Does not work with genderless Pok\u00e9mon.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.272"}}

Snag Machine.embed: {"title":"Snag Machine","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":30000},{"name":"Slot","value":"Accessory"}],"description":"Snag Machines are extremely illegal machines that allow trainers to steal another Trainer\u2019s Pok\u00e9mon. They come in both large, immovable varieties and smaller portable varieties. The Portable Variety is an Accessory-Slot Item. Inserting a Pok\u00e9 Ball into a Large Snag Machine turns it into a Snag Ball permanently, but Large Snag Machines may only turn 5 Pok\u00e9 Balls into Snag Balls per day. Inserting a Pok\u00e9 Ball into a Portable Snag Machine, which is a Swift Action, turns it into a Snag Ball after one round, but only for that round. Snag Balls have the same properties as the Pok\u00e9 Ball type they were before being inserted into the machine, but receive a -2 penalty on all Pok\u00e9 Ball attack rolls, and are capable of capturing owned Pok\u00e9mon. Snag Machines cannot be bought in stores, but may sell on the black market for prices of $30,000 or more.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.295"}}

Medicine Case.embed: {"title":"Medicine Case","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":400},{"name":"Mod","value":"--"}],"description":"A Medicine Case may be filled with an Antidote, Paralyze Heal, Burn Heal, Ice Heal, or Full Heal. This consumes the used item. When a Pok\u00e9mon is recalled into a Pok\u00e9 Ball with a filled Medicine Case, the item is automatically used on the Pok\u00e9mon. Filling a Medicine Case is an Standard Action. Medicine Cases may be refilled multiple times but may only have one sort of consumable in them at a time.","footer":{"text":"DPDoM: p.44"}}
